projectDesc.p: The Greenfield Digital Project interprets the story of Bankers Trust Company, a large Philadelphia bank that failed in 1930, through a selection of primary source documents, contextual essays, and teacher resources. The project is part of a larger effort funded by the Albert M. Greenfield Foundation to make HSP's 20th-century holdings more accessible.

editorialDecl.p: This electronic file was created using manual keying following the recommendations for Level 4 of "Best Practices for TEI in Libraries" guidelines v3.0.

We have generally encoded entire documents/texts, not excerpts. We have encoded page breaks. We have also preserved original spelling, typographical errors, missing text, and original capitalization. For clippings from newspapers or other publications, we have transcribed just the text related to the article, ignoring other text or markings on the page that were purposefully or inadvertently included during clipping. We have regularized spacing between words and sentences to replace double (or triple) spaces to a single space.
We have not coded line breaks, end-of-line hyphenation, visual rendition of layout, font changes, or text alignment (left, right, center).

div.p: We are pleased to join in announcing that Bankers Trust Company and Bank of Philadelphia and Trust Company, by unanimous vote of the directors of both Banks, have consolidated to establish greater banking facilities.Lewis also sent a letter on this date to stockholders of Bank of Philadelphia and Trust Company, as well as a personal letter to "depositors and customers" explaining why he thought the consolidation made sense. Both banks have worked to establish in each neighborhood center where located, the services of a strong financial institution.
The consolidated institution will maintain 19 offices. It has over $50,000,000. of deposits and resources of about $60,000,000.

We are glad to welcome into this greater institution, - BANKERS TRUST COMPANY OF PHILADELPHIA, - all our customers and their friends. You may continue to use your present check book until such time as it is convenient for you to have us furnish you with a new one.

The official families of both institutions are now welded into one strong organization, and our officers will welcome the opportunity of personally meeting our depositors. You may confidently expect hearty welcome, careful attention, ready service and every regard for your interest and welfare.

closer.signed: BANKERS TRUST COMPANY OF PHILADELPHIA, Samuel H. Barker President L. A. Lewis Vice-President
